channel.title: CyberNetSec - Threat Intelligence
channel.description: Latest threat intelligence threat intelligence - the last 10 articles

item.title: Ransomware Evolves: "ClickFix" Social Engineering and Threat Actor Alliances on the Rise
item.description:
A December 2025 threat report from NCC Group indicates that while ransomware attack volumes plateaued in November with 583 incidents, their sophistication markedly increased. Attackers are increasingly adopting the "ClickFix" (also known as ClearFake) social engineering technique, which tricks users...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Threat Actor, Threat Intelligence

Read Full Article →

item.title: AI Adoption Fuels 'Massive' Cloud Attack Surface Expansion, Palo Alto Networks Report Warns
item.description:
Palo Alto Networks' 2025 'State of Cloud Security Report' reveals that the rapid adoption of AI is creating an unprecedented expansion of the cloud attack surface. The study, surveying 2,800 security leaders, found that 99% of organizations have had their AI systems attacked in the last year. The us...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Cloud Security, Threat Intelligence, Policy and Compliance

Read Full Article →

item.title: CISA Orders Federal Agencies to Patch Actively Exploited Critical GeoServer XXE Flaw
item.description:
The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) has added a critical XML External Entity (XXE) injection vulnerability in OSGeo GeoServer, CVE-2025-58360, to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog. The flaw, which has a CVSS score up to 9.8, allows an unauthenticated remo...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Threat Intelligence, Regulatory

Read Full Article →

item.title: New 'PyStoreRAT' Malware Spreads Via Fake OSINT and AI Tools on GitHub
item.description:
A new malware campaign is distributing an information-stealing Remote Access Trojan (RAT) called 'PyStoreRAT' through fake GitHub repositories. Threat actors create repositories for what appear to be legitimate OSINT, AI, or DeFi tools, artificially inflating their popularity with fake stars and for...

Severity: High

Categories: Malware, Supply Chain Attack, Threat Intelligence

Read Full Article →

item.title: India Confirms GPS Spoofing Attacks Targeted Seven Major Airports
item.description:
The Indian government has officially confirmed that a series of cyber incidents involving GPS spoofing have occurred at seven of the nation's major airports. The attacks, which targeted airports in Delhi, Mumbai, Kolkata, and Bengaluru among others, disrupted navigation data for aircraft utilizing G...

Severity: High

Categories: Cyberattack, Industrial Control Systems, Threat Intelligence

Read Full Article →

item.title: Stealthy NANOREMOTE Backdoor Abuses Google Drive API for C2 Communications
item.description:
A new and fully-featured Windows backdoor, dubbed NANOREMOTE, has been discovered by Elastic Security Labs. Written in C++, the malware distinguishes itself by using the Google Drive API for all command-and-control (C2) communications, allowing it to blend in with legitimate cloud traffic and evade ...

Severity: High

Categories: Malware, Threat Intelligence, Cloud Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: OpenAI Unveils Strategy to Manage 'High' Risk AI Cybersecurity Threats
item.description:
OpenAI has announced its strategy for managing the significant cybersecurity risks posed by its increasingly powerful AI models. The company will now treat all future models as potentially 'High' risk under its Preparedness Framework, capable of automating vulnerability discovery and exploitation. K...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Threat Intelligence

Read Full Article →

item.title: "Battering RAM": $50 Hardware Attack Cracks Intel and AMD Secure CPU Enclaves
item.description:
At the Black Hat Europe 2025 conference, researchers from KU Leuven University demonstrated "Battering RAM," a novel hardware attack that completely undermines modern confidential computing technologies. Using a custom-built DDR4 interposer costing just $50, the attack can bypass the memory encrypti...

Severity: High

Categories: Cyberattack, Threat Intelligence, Supply Chain Attack

item.title: Ransomware Goes Global, Targeting New Regions and Industries with Weaker Defenses
item.description:
Ransomware is becoming a more globalized and unpredictable threat, according to the H2 2025 Global Threat Briefing from cyber analytics firm CyberCube. The report warns that ransomware groups are actively expanding into new geographic regions and industry sectors that have historically seen fewer at...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Threat Intelligence, Ransomware

item.title: Hackers Use Animated Lures and Fake Legal Warnings to Spread Malware
item.description:
HP's latest Threat Insights Report reveals a significant evolution in social engineering tactics, with cybercriminals using highly convincing lures such as professional animations and fake legal warnings to trick users into downloading malware. The report highlights a campaign impersonating the Colo...

Severity: High

Categories: Phishing, Malware, Threat Intelligence
